examples.code:
<ff-data-table :columns="cols" :rows="rows" :show-search="true"
	search-placeholder="Search here..." v-model:search="search">
	<template v-slot:actions>
		<ff-button>Press Me!</ff-button>
		<ff-button>Click Me!</ff-button>
	</template>
</ff-data-table>

<ff-data-table :columns="cols">
	<template v-slot:rows>
		<ff-data-table-row>
			<ff-data-table-cell>Testing</ff-data-table-cell>
			<ff-data-table-cell>We can put anything in here...</ff-data-table-cell>
			<ff-data-table-cell>
				<ff-notification-pill :count="4"/>
			</ff-data-table-cell>
		</ff-data-table-row>
	</template>
</ff-data-table>

<ff-data-table>
	<template v-slot:header>
		<ff-data-table-row>
			<ff-data-table-cell>Custom Header</ff-data-table-cell>
			<ff-data-table-cell>We can put anything in here too...</ff-data-table-cell>
			<ff-data-table-cell>
				<ff-notification-pill :count="74"/>
			</ff-data-table-cell>
		</ff-data-table-row>
	</template>
	<template v-slot:rows>
		<ff-data-table-row v-for="row in rows" :key="row" selectable @select="doSomething">
			<ff-data-table-cell>{{ row.fName }}</ff-data-table-cell>
			<ff-data-table-cell>{{ row.sName }}</ff-data-table-cell>
			<ff-data-table-cell>
				<ff-notification-pill :count="row.number"/>
			</ff-data-table-cell>
		</ff-data-table-row>
	</template>
</ff-data-table>

<ff-data-table :columns="cols" :rows="rows" :show-search="true" v-model:search="search" 
	:search-fields="['sName', 'number']" search-placeholder="search-fields limits
	which properties the search applies to.">
</ff-data-table>

props.description: An array of objects that define the column headers and assocated keys in the `rows` data. e.g. [{key: 'colA', label: 'Column A'}]
An array of objects defining each row of data. Each object should contains the relevant key defined in the columns array. e.g. [{colA: 1}]
Defines whether or not the full row can be clicked, in order to emit a 'row-selected' event.
Whether or not to display the ff-text-input to filter the table content
If `show-search` is true, then this proeprty will set the placeholder of the search bar.
If null, the search will look through the entire data object provided, otherwise, it will only consider the fields provided in the array. Recommendation is to provide this value.
Defines whether or not to show the 'Load More...' option at the bottom of the table. Clicking this button will emit a 'load-more' event. Usually used to control pagination in an API.
Shows a placeholder Loading message in place of the data.
If loading=true, then this message will be shown.

slots.name: table
slots.description: Replace the full table portion of the component, this does not affect the search bar of actions slot

slots.name: actions
slots.description: Provide buttons and/or links to render above the table.

slots.name: header
slots.description: Replaces the default data-table header row.

slots.name: context-menu
slots.description: Define a collection of ff-list-item components that can be rendered for each rows context-menu. For the @click for each of these, make sure no () are used, e.g. @click="doSomething", by default the row's data object will get passed to any @click function provided.

emits.description: The object associated with the row clicked.

props.description: An array of objects that define the column headers and assocated keys in the data. e.g. [{key: 'colA', label: 'Column A'}]
<Object> Data to render in this row. The exact data that will be rendered from this object will be defined in the 'columns' property.
<Boolean> Whether or not clicking this row emits a 'selected' event with the relevant data bound to the event.

slots.name: default
slots.description: Replace the full content of the row. Recommended to use ff-table-data-cells inside.

slots.name: context-menu
slots.description: If included, this row will display an ff-kebab-menu at the end of each row with the provided options. It is recommended to use ff-list-items when filling this slot.

slots.name: default
slots.description: Populate the content of the cell.

props.description: The number of columns this particular cell should cover.
